citation.article-title: Transfer of staurosporine-producing strain Streptomyces staurosporus AM-2282 to the genus Saccharothrix as Saccharothrix aerocolonigenes (Labeda 1986) subsp. staurosporeus subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Saccharothrix aerocolonigenes subsp. staurosporeus subsp. nov.
Saccharothrix aerocolonigenes subsp. staurosporeus (st.a´u.ro.sp o´re. us. G. n. stauros, stave; G. n. spora a spore; M. L. adj. staurosporeus, referring to a slender spore)
The color of vegetative mycelia is yellow.
Aerial mycelia is produced on general agar media.
Aerial mass color is white to pink.
Spore chains are straight or flexuous.
Acid production from dextrin and raffinose is positive. but negative from salicin.
The G+C content of DNA of the type strain is 67%.
The type strain of SSaccharothrix aerocolonigenes subsp. staurosporeus is AM-2282 (NRRL 11184).
